text: The Czech Republic first took part in the Olympic Games as an independent country in 1994. It has competed in every Summer Olympic Games and Winter Olympic Games since then. Before 1993, Czech athletes took part in the Olympics from 1920 to 1992 as Czechoslovakia and from 1900 to 1912 as Bohemia. Athletes from the Czech Republic have won a total of 43 medals at the Summer Games. Canoeing, shooting and athletics have been their best sports. They have also won 16 medals at the Winter Games. Most of their medals came from the Czech Republic national ice hockey team and cross-country skier Kateřina Neumannová. The National Olympic Committee for the Czech Republic is the Czech Olympic Committee. It was founded in 1899 and accepted by the International Olympic Committee in 1993. ==Medal tables== ===Medals by Summer Games=== Games Athletes Gold Silver Bronze Total Rank 1900–1912 as Bohemia as Bohemia as Bohemia as Bohemia as Bohemia as Bohemia 1920–1992 as part of Czechoslovakia as part of Czechoslovakia as part of Czechoslovakia as part of Czechoslovakia as part of Czechoslovakia as part of Czechoslovakia 1996 Atlanta 115 4 3 4 11 17 2000 Sydney 119 2 3 3 8 28 2004 Athens 142 1 3 4 8 42 2008 Beijing 134 3 3 0 6 24 2012 London 133 4 3 3 10 19 Total Total 14 15 14 43 45 ===Medals by Winter Games=== 1994 Lillehammer 0 0 0 0 1998 Nagano 1 1 1 3 2002 Salt Lake City 1 2 0 3 2006 Turin 1 2 1 4 2010 Vancouver 2 0 4 6 Total 5 5 6 16 ===Medals by summer sport=== Canoeing 4 4 3 11 Athletics 5 1 4 10 Shooting 2 3 4 9 Rowing 1 2 0 4 Tennis 0 2 1 3 Modern pentathlon 1 0 1 2 Cycling 1 0 0 1 Boxing 0 1 0 1 Sailing 0 1 0 1 Triathlon 0 0 1 1 Total 14 15 14 43 ===Medals by winter sport=== Cross-country skiing 1 5 3 9 Ice hockey 1 0 1 2 Freestyle skiing 1 0 0 1 Speed skating 2 0 1 3 Alpine skiing 0 0 1 1 Total 5 5 6 16 ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes * Czechoslovakia at the Olympics * Bohemia at the Olympics == References == ==Other websites == * Czech Republic profile at London2012.com Category:Nations at the Olympics Olympics
title: Czech Republic at the Olympics
